description: Year of Survey
Numerical code of the school
The administration of the school is federal (1); state (2); municipal (3), or private (4). Federal, state, and municipal schools are considered public.
The school is located in an urban (1) or rural area (2)

The school provides drinking water with quality suitable for human consumption (i.e., ingestion, preparation, and production of food) according to the Brazilian national water quality standards (former Portaria nº 2.914/2011 now Portaria de Consolidação nº5/2017) (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The water in the school is supplied by a public network (1 – Yes; 0 – No).
The water in the school is supplied by a borehole (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The water in the school is supplied by a cacimba, cistern, or well (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The water in the school is supplied by surface water source (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
There is no water supply in the school (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The school dispose their sewage into a public sewerage system (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The school dispose their sewage into  septic tank (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The solid waste in the school is regularly collected by the public cleaning service (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The solid waste in the school is disposed in an area licensed by environmental agencies, intended to receive solid waste in a planned manner (e.g., landfills) (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The solid waste in the school is burned or incinerated (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The solid waste in the school is buried (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The solid waste in the school is disposed in another area (none of the other options) (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The school is equipped with sanitary facilities for personal hygiene/physiological needs (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The school is equipped with sanitary facilities for children 0 to 5 years old (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The school is equipped with disability-friendly sanitary facilities following the national guidelines (ABNT - NBR 9050) (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The school is equipped with  sanitary facilities for personal hygiene/physiological needs exclusively for staff (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
The school is equipped with  sanitary facilities or changing room or washing room with appropriate equipment (shower) for bathing, exclusively for students (1 – Yes; 0 – No)
Total number of students per school
Percentage of girls per school
Percentage of boys per school
Percentage of students that are classified or self-identified as white race/skin color per school
Percentage of students that are classified or self-identified as black race/skin color per school
Percentage of students that are classified or self-identified as brown race/skin color per school
Percentage of students that are classified or self-identified as Asian race/skin color per school
Percentage of students that are classified or self-identified as indigenous race/skin color per school
Percentage of students that did not declared race/skin color per school
Percentage of students in daycare (0 - 3 years old)
Percentage of students in preschool (4 - 5 years old)
Percentage of students in primary education first cycle (6 - 10 years old)
Percentage of students in primary education second cycle (11 - 14 years old)
Percentage of students in secondary education (15 - 18 years old)
